info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 11:23PM EDT until October 27 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
FFWMFL
The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Broward County in southeastern Florida...
* Until 115 AM EDT.
* At 1123 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach, Plantation, Tamarac, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Wilton Manors, Sea Ranch Lakes, Lazy Lake, Twin Lakes, Golden Heights, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Franklin Park, Washington Park, St. George, Melrose Park, North Andrews Gardens and Rock Island.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
